thread.title: Odell Beckham, Jr.'s hamstring ready, is active Monday against Eagles - CBSSports.com
thread.title_full: Odell Beckham, Jr.'s hamstring ready, is active Monday against Eagles - CBSSports.com

title: Odell Beckham, Jr.'s hamstring ready, is active Monday against Eagles - CBSSports.com
text:
Odell Beckham, Jr.'s hamstring ready, is active Monday against Eagles By Will Brinson | NFL Writer October 19, 2015 6:37 PM ET 
Update (7 p.m. ET) : Beckham is officially cleared to play and is ACTIVE for the Giants Monday night. Rueben Randle is also good go, meaning Eli Manning should have a full arsenal at his disposal. 
It felt like there was a decent chance Odell Beckham , Jr., could end up missing Monday night's divisional matchup against the Eagles . Or at the very least be a decoy. 
Based on the Giants wide receiver's warmups, however, it doesn't appear to be the case. 
Beckham is out on the field punting the ball (he's always doing something zany in warmups) and, as chronicled in video form by Ralph Vacchiano of the New York Daily News , looking pretty sharp with his cuts. 
The Giants need Beckham to play and play well, with a potential shootout coming against the Eagles in Philadelphia. 
Yeah, he's fine ... pic.twitter.com/aQTunG6fKa â€” Ralph Vacchiano (@RVacchianoNYDN) October 19, 2015 
If Beckham is a decoy, you wouldn't know it based on this video. He looks sharp as can be and potentially explosive. You're breathing a sigh of relief if you gambled and started him in fantasy this week. 
The Giants should be feeling much better about their chances as well. 
ESPN analyst Ray Lewis was spotted on the field talking to Beckham around 6:15 p.m. ET and, smiling broadly, said "I think you have a good chance of seeing Odell Beckham play tonight." 
Tom Coughlin told Suzy Kolber that Beckham "is expected to play." 
Beckham is 'expected to play' Monday night. (USATSI)
